newsitem.title: ITALY: New Holland sees rise in margins, turnover.
newsitem.headline: New Holland sees rise in margins, turnover.

text.p: New Holland, the farm machinery division of Italy's Fiat, sees sales rising six to eight percent in 1997-98 on positive forecast orders and a rise in margins, share analysts said on Monday after a meeting with the group.
They quoted company managers as saying that the gross margin should rise by one percentage point in 1997-98 and operating profit should rise by two points.
Analysts said they were working out their forecasts accordingly but could not yet comment further.
Fiat plans to float at least 31 percent of New Holland on the New York stock exchange later this year to raise up to $1.23 billion. The float is seen as broadly neutral for Fiat's earnings this year.
